com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface WMIConnection2

public interface WMIConnection2

Interface provided to agents when they have established a connection to a WMI data source. This offers a database-like API for executing queries to retrieve data, so this currently return something like a Statement object.

Since:
5.5.5.4

Method Summary
 WMIResultSet2 executeQuery(java.lang.String query, long timeoutMillis)
          Execute a WMI query.

Method Detail

executeQuery

WMIResultSet2 executeQuery(java.lang.String query,
                           long timeoutMillis)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
Execute a WMI query. This is used to grab stuff like performance counters for hosts and is very similar to SQL. This method can safely be access simultaneously by multiple threads, however the result set that is returned is not.

Parameters:
query - The query string to execute
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before timing out or 0 to disable timeouts entirely
Returns:
The results of the query
Throws:
java.io.IOException - The connection to the remote host was broken
java.lang.InterruptedException - This thread was interrupted before the query could complete
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - The query did not complete within timeoutMillis milliseconds

getArchitecture

java.lang.String getArchitecture(long timeoutMillis)
Try to guess the canonical architecture type of the remote system. This method assumes that the target system is some flavour of UNIX and supports the uname command. It is a convenience method for executing uname -m and mapping the results through CanonicalNameService.getArchitecture(String arch).

If any errors are detected the failure will be logged on the agent's behalf and this method will return null.

Parameters:
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before failing
Returns:
The results of uname -s mapped into Quest's canonical operating system type
See Also:
CanonicalNameService.getArchitecture(String arch)

getHostName

java.lang.String getHostName(long timeoutMillis)
Attempt to return the canonical host name for this machine. This method assumes that the target system is some flavour of UNIX and supports the uname command. It is simply a convenience method for executing uname -n, parsing the results, and logging any thrown exceptions.

If the remote system is a windows box running an SSH server this command will fail in undefined ways, the most likely way being successfully executing but returning garbage as the hostname.

If any errors are detected the failure will be logged on the agent's behalf and this method will return null.

Parameters:
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before failing
Returns:
The results of uname -n or null if an error occurred

getOperatingSystemType

java.lang.String getOperatingSystemType(long timeoutMillis)
Try to guess the canonical operating system type. This method assumes that the target system is some flavour of UNIX and supports the uname command. It is simply a convenience method for executing uname -s and mapping the results through CanonicalNameService.getOperatingSystemType(String name).

If any errors are detected the failure will be logged on the agent's behalf and this method will return null.

Parameters:
timeoutMillis - The number of milliseconds to wait before failing
Returns:
The results of uname -s mapped into Quest's canonical operating system type
See Also:
CanonicalNameService.getOperatingSystemType(String name)
